newsitem.title: FRANCE: DMC sees breakeven within two years.
newsitem.headline: DMC sees breakeven within two years.

text.p: French textile group DMC expects to reach breakeven within two years, chairman Jacques Boubal said in an interview in the weekly Journal des Finances.

"Our redeployment plan is very ambitious. Within two years, our results should break even," he is quoted as saying in the edition appearing on newsstands on Saturday. An advance copy was sent to Reuters.
"In 1997 our pre-tax, pre-exceptional income will show a sharp improvement but will still be in deficit," he said.
The group in September forecast a loss for 1996 but did not rule out a return to profit the following year.
Boubal said the group had held its debt this year at around 900 million francs and may even show a reduction of 50 million to 100 million francs by year's end.
He said the company had medium-term credits of 1.65 billion francs and had only used 500 million. "The financial situation of the group is excellent," he said.
